title: Why pay monthly for Acrobat when you can get basically the same thing for life
content:
Macworld

While PDFs are the most universally used and shared document types, it’s surprising how difficult it is to edit their contents. You could invest in Adobe Acrobat to get the necessary tools to alter your PDFs, but you’d be paying yet another subscription for something you could own.

With PDF Reader Pro, you’ll get lifetime access to the same editing, annotation, and conversion tools Adobe provides—without the annoying subscription—for your Mac. This suite’s all-in-one PDF management tools are now on sale for only $24.97 (reg. $59).

Manage your PDFs seamlessly, all in one app on your device. Check out what you’ll be able to do:

  • Edit the original text and images on your PDFs.
  • Organize, rearrange, crop, merge, and delete PDF pages as needed.
  • Compare PDFs side by side and leave comments or annotations.
  • Convert PDFs to and from files like Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Text, HTML, etc.
  • Customize your PDFs with watermarks, headers, and footers (batch adding is also available).

If you work in the legal field or run your own business, you’ll appreciate this app’s privacy and signature features. You can protect sensitive PDFs with passwords so only authorized users can access them, redact confidential text and images, and even insert sections for legally binding and customizable digital signatures to be added.

Equip your Mac with this lifetime subscription to PDF Reader Pro, now just $24.97 through January 12 at 11:59 PM Pacific!
